tn.text: "by their military divisions." This means that each tribe had their own men, who were armed, to protect them. See how you translated "armed groups" in [[:en:bible:notes:num:01:01|1:3]].
This can be stated in active form. AT: "as Yahweh commanded" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"from one place to another place"
Moses lists the places the Israelites went after they left Egypt. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: during the first month, leaving on the fifteenth day of the first month
tn.text: Here "first" is the ordinal number one and "fifteenth" is the ordinal number fifteen. This is the first month of the Hebrew calendar. The fifteenth day is near the beginning of April on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: the people of Israel left openly, in the sight of all the Egyptians
tn.text: "the Israelites left in plain view of the Egyptians"
This refers to the firstborn sons. AT: "their firstborn sons" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: he also inflicted punishment on their gods
tn.text: Yahweh proving that he is more powerful than all of the false gods that the Egyptians worshiped is spoken of as if Yahweh punished those false gods. AT: "he also proved that he is greater than their gods" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.text: "Each clan will receive the land according to how the lot falls"

tn.ref: like objects in your eyes and thorns in your sides
tn.text: Just like a small object in a person's eye or a small thorn that sticks into a person skin can cause great irritation, so even a small portion of the Canaanites, if left in the land, would cause great trouble for the Israelites. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
